title: Cardiovascular Disease Testing | Synchrony Labs
heroDescription: Complete cardiovascular testing solutions for every device category and therapeutic application.
subpagesSectionDescription: Select your specific testing need below, or scroll down to learn more about our cardiovascular testing approach and specialized capabilities.

subpages.heading: Heart Failure Testing
subpages.text: Mechanical circulatory support validation including LVAD pump performance, hemocompatibility, and durability testing with infection resistance protocols.

subpages.heading: Heart Valve Testing
subpages.text: TAVR, TMVR, and transcatheter valve evaluation with deployment mechanics, hydrodynamic performance, and durability assessment.

subpages.heading: Structural Heart Testing
subpages.text: LAA closure, PFO occluders, and septal defect device validation with deployment accuracy and tissue incorporation assessment.

subpages.heading: Arrhythmia Device Testing
subpages.text: Pacemaker and ICD device validation with electrical performance testing and lead system biocompatibility protocols.

subpages.heading: Coronary Stent Testing
subpages.text: Drug-eluting stent evaluation including drug release kinetics, polymer biocompatibility, and vascular healing assessment.

whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony for Cardiovascular Testing
whyChooseDescription: Our cardiovascular testing capabilities stem from four decades of exclusive focus in this therapeutic area, providing specialized infrastructure, expertise, and regulatory success.

whyChooseCards.heading: Dual Catheterization Laboratories
whyChooseCards.text: Two fully-equipped cath labs with high-resolution fluoroscopy, digital subtraction angiography, IVUS integration, and hemodynamic monitoring systems.

whyChooseCards.heading: Cardiovascular Specialists
whyChooseCards.text: Our team includes interventional specialists who understand deployment mechanics, veterinary pathologists experienced with vascular healing, and regulatory experts.

whyChooseCards.heading: Proven Regulatory Success
whyChooseCards.text: Over four decades of exclusive cardiovascular device testing has produced hundreds of successful FDA submissions.

featuredServices.heading: Heart Valve Testing
featuredServices.text: Transcatheter heart valves need to prove they can deploy accurately, function properly, and seal completely under real-world conditions. We test valve performance against ISO 5840 standards, run durability cycles exceeding 400 million beats, and validate anatomical fit across TAVR, TMVR, and tricuspid platforms. Our imaging capabilitiesâ€”including TEE and high-resolution fluoroscopyâ€”let us track valve positioning, leaflet movement, and any regurgitation throughout the entire study.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Heart Valve Testing

featuredServices.heading: Structural Heart Testing
featuredServices.text: LAA closure devices, PFO occluders, and septal defect devices face unique challenges that standard cardiac testing can't address. We evaluate how well these devices deploy in complex anatomy, stay stable during cardiac motion, and integrate with surrounding tissue over time. Our Watchman LAA testing program is one of our most established services, refined through dozens of studies that have supported both FDA submissions and post-market surveillance.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Structural Heart Testing

featuredServices.heading: Coronary Stent Testing
featuredServices.text: Drug-eluting stents require careful validation of how the drug releases, how the polymer behaves, and how the vessel heals. We use standardized histology to measure strut coverage, inflammation, and restenosis rates over time. Our analytical methods track drug distribution in vessel walls and polymer degradation kinetics. Whether you're working with established DES platforms or newer bioresorbable scaffolds, our protocols are designed to support both 510(k) and PMA pathways.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Coronary Stent Testing

title: Neurovascular Device Testing | Synchrony Labs
heroDescription: Specialized preclinical validation for stroke intervention and aneurysm treatment devices.
subpagesSectionDescription: Select your specific testing need below, or scroll down to learn more about our neurovascular testing approach and specialized capabilities.

subpages.heading: Thrombectomy Testing
subpages.text: Stent retriever and combination device evaluation including clot engagement efficiency, retrieval force optimization, and first-pass recanalization assessment with vessel preservation protocols.

subpages.heading: Direct Aspiration Thrombectomy Testing
subpages.text: Direct aspiration catheter validation for stroke, coronary, and peripheral applications. Vacuum force generation, clot extraction efficiency, and complete recanalization assessment.

subpages.heading: Liquid Embolic Device Testing
subpages.text: Polymer delivery system validation for aneurysm and AVM treatment. DMSO compatibility, radiopacity assessment, and controlled polymerization testing with occlusion effectiveness protocols.

whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony for Neurovascular Testing
whyChooseDescription: Our neurovascular testing capabilities stem from specialized focus in cerebrovascular device development, providing dedicated infrastructure, stroke intervention expertise, and proven regulatory success.

whyChooseCards.heading: Neurovascular Specialization
whyChooseCards.text: Fifteen years focused exclusively on cerebrovascular device testing provides deep understanding of stroke intervention and aneurysm treatment requirements. Our protocols address unique challenges of brain tissue safety and tortuous vessel navigation while maintaining complete GLP compliance throughout neurovascular studies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Advanced Testing Infrastructure
whyChooseCards.text: Purpose-built catheterization laboratories with high-resolution angiography and real-time hemodynamic monitoring. Anatomically accurate cerebral vessel models enable clinically relevant performance assessment while specialized clot simulation systems replicate diverse thrombus compositions.

whyChooseCards.heading: Regulatory Success Record
whyChooseCards.text: Proven track record supporting successful FDA submissions for neurovascular devices across multiple regulatory pathways. Our team understands PMA requirements and 510(k) substantial equivalence demonstrations specific to stroke devices and cerebrovascular applications.

featuredServices.heading: Thrombectomy Testing
featuredServices.text: Mechanical thrombectomy devices need to prove they can engage clots effectively, achieve first-pass recanalization, and preserve vessel integrity during emergency stroke procedures. We test device performance using advanced clot simulation systems that replicate diverse thrombus compositions, validating retrieval mechanics and TICI scoring across stent retrievers and combination devices. Our catheterization laboratories provide angiographic documentation of recanalization success while anatomically accurate cerebral vessel models enable realistic performance assessment throughout the entire study.

featuredServices.heading: Direct Aspiration Thrombectomy Testing
featuredServices.text: Aspiration catheters require validation of vacuum force generation, clot extraction efficiency, and complete vessel recanalization across neurovascular, coronary, and peripheral applications. We evaluate aspiration performance using standardized clot compositionsâ€”from fresh platelet-rich thrombi to organized fibrin materialâ€”ensuring devices handle the full spectrum of clinical scenarios. Our testing protocols assess catheter trackability through tortuous cerebral anatomy, aspiration force consistency during extended procedures, and biocompatibility requirements for blood-contacting devices.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Aspiration Thrombectomy Testing

featuredServices.heading: Liquid Embolic Device Testing
featuredServices.text: Liquid embolic agents face unique challenges that standard biocompatibility testing can't address. We validate polymer viscosity, radiopacity, and polymerization kinetics using specialized protocols for DMSO compatibility, tantalum suspension stability, and controlled precipitation behavior. Our catheterization laboratories feature imaging systems configured specifically for liquid embolic visualization, while ISO 10993-compliant testing addresses material characterization and delivery performance across aneurysm, AVM, and peripheral embolization applications.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Liquid Embolic Testing

title: Peripheral Vascular Testing | Synchrony Labs
heroDescription: Specialized testing across carotid, aortic, venous, and embolic protection applications with territory-specific protocols, anatomical models, and regulatory expertise.
subpagesSectionDescription: Our specialized peripheral vascular testing services address carotid through venous applications. Select your specific testing need below, or scroll down to learn more about our territory-specific capabilities.

subpages.heading: Carotid Stent Testing
subpages.text: Cerebrovascular testing for carotid stents addressing embolic protection, plaque scaffolding, and stroke prevention.

subpages.heading: AAA Device Testing
subpages.text: Endovascular aneurysm repair testing with high-pressure containment, seal integrity, and durability validation.

subpages.heading: IVC Filter Testing
subpages.text: Venous embolic capture testing with flow preservation, retrieval mechanics, and biocompatibility assessment.

subpages.heading: Embolic Protection Devices
subpages.text: Procedural safety device testing with debris capture efficiency and flow preservation validation.

whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony Labs for Peripheral Vascular Testing
whyChooseDescription: Our peripheral vascular testing expertise combines 40+ years of cardiovascular device validation experience with specialized infrastructure addressing the unique requirements of carotid, aortic, venous, and embolic protection technologies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Territory-Specific Expertise
whyChooseCards.text: Our team recognizes that carotid stents, AAA devices, IVC filters, and embolic protection systems each require distinct testing approaches. Our protocols address territory-specific biomechanical challenges, regulatory expectations, and clinical performance requirements rather than applying generic vascular device assessment methodologies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Specialized Testing Infrastructure
whyChooseCards.text: Purpose-built testing systems address peripheral vascular requirements including high-pressure aortic simulation, cerebrovascular flow modeling, venous circulation replication, and embolic challenge systems. This specialized infrastructure enables comprehensive device validation that generic cardiovascular facilities cannot provide.

whyChooseCards.heading: Multi-Disciplinary Team
whyChooseCards.text: Our personnel include interventional specialists with expertise across cerebrovascular, aortic, and venous territories, biomedical engineers specializing in vascular device mechanics, and regulatory experts with successful peripheral device submission experience. This combination ensures comprehensive evaluation addressing both technical performance and regulatory acceptance.

featuredServices.heading: Carotid Stent Testing
featuredServices.text: Carotid stent development requires specialized cerebrovascular testing that addresses embolic risk, plaque stabilization, and vessel scaffolding in the critical carotid circulation. We evaluate embolic generation, plaque compression, and patency maintenance using anatomically accurate carotid bifurcation models that replicate the unique hemodynamics of cerebral circulation. Our testing protocols span self-expanding nitinol systems, balloon-expandable designs, and drug-eluting platforms, with advanced embolic monitoring systems evaluating particle generation during deployment across various plaque types. Specialized protocols assess plaque stabilization effectiveness, deployment precision through tortuous anatomy, and chronic thrombogenicity in the cerebrovascular environment.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Carotid Stent Testing

featuredServices.heading: AAA Device Testing
featuredServices.text: Abdominal aortic aneurysm repair systems need to prove they can withstand systolic pressure cycles while providing complete aneurysm exclusion and maintaining critical branch vessel perfusion. We evaluate pressure containment, endoleak prevention, and structural integrity using high-pressure flow circuits and anatomically accurate aneurysm models that accommodate modular stent grafts, unibody designs, and fenestrated devices with branch vessel preservation. Advanced pressure monitoring provides real-time seal integrity assessment while leak detection systems identify potential endoleak pathways. Accelerated fatigue testing simulates decades of cardiac pressure cycles, characterizing material durability and component interface integrity throughout intended device life.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About AAA Device Testing

featuredServices.heading: IVC Filter Testing
featuredServices.text: Inferior vena cava filter development requires specialized venous testing that addresses clot capture efficiency, flow preservation, and retrieval mechanics in the low-pressure, large-diameter venous environment. We evaluate embolic challenge response, anchoring stability, and biocompatibility using high-volume venous flow circuits that replicate physiological IVC hemodynamics. Our testing addresses both permanent filter designs requiring long-term biocompatibility validation and retrievable systems demanding comprehensive retrieval mechanics assessment. Advanced embolic simulation systems deliver calibrated thrombus analogs across clinically relevant size ranges while specialized protocols characterize retrieval force requirements and safe recovery timelines.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About IVC Filter Testing

title: Surgical Robotics Testing | Synchrony Labs
heroDescription: Comprehensive validation protocols for robotic surgical platforms addressing teleoperation accuracy, force feedback calibration, and tremor filtration effectiveness.
subpagesSectionDescription: Specialized validation protocols for teleoperated and robotic-assisted surgical platforms.

subpages.heading: Endoscopic Device Testing
subpages.text: Flexible endoscope validation including articulation range of motion, tip deflection control precision, and visualization system performance. Camera resolution assessment, illumination stability, and working channel functionality evaluation.

subpages.heading: Laparoscopic Testing
subpages.text: Minimally invasive surgical instrument evaluation including grasping force measurement, articulation precision, and tissue manipulation assessment. Trocar seal integrity, insufflation maintenance, and instrument durability under repeated use.

whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony for Surgical Robotics Testing
whyChooseDescription: Our surgical robotics testing capabilities stem from four decades of minimally invasive device development, providing specialized infrastructure, precision instrument expertise, and proven regulatory success.

whyChooseCards.heading: Specialized Surgical Suite
whyChooseCards.text: Dedicated surgical suite accommodates full robotic systems with patient cart positioning, vision cart integration, and surgeon console setup matching clinical configurations. Advanced monitoring systems capture real-time performance data during robotic procedures. Environmental controls maintain sterile conditions and consistent testing parameters throughout validation studies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Minimally Invasive Expertise
whyChooseCards.text: Our founding heritage established by Duke University interventional cardiologists who pioneered current minimally invasive techniques provides deep understanding of precision surgical requirements. This cardiovascular specialization translates directly to robotic surgery validation, addressing teleoperation accuracy, force feedback systems, and safety protocols essential for FDA submission success.

whyChooseCards.heading: GLP Compliance and Regulatory Success
whyChooseCards.text: AAALAC accreditation ensures highest standards for surgical research protocols while GLP compliance under 21 CFR Part 58 provides regulatory documentation required for FDA submissions. Our quality management system delivers complete traceability and comprehensive documentation supporting successful regulatory pathways for complex electromechanical systems.

featuredServices.heading: Endoscopic Device Testing
featuredServices.text: Flexible endoscopic systems for robotic surgery require validation of mechanical articulation, visualization performance, and working channel functionality. We test articulation range across multiple degrees of freedom, tip deflection precision under varying loads, and camera resolution for diagnostic imaging. Our protocols evaluate illumination stability, image transmission quality, and working channel patency throughout articulation cycles. Our optical testing equipment and mechanical fatigue systems track performance metrics throughout thousands of articulation cycles to ensure devices meet ISO 8600 standards.

featuredServices.heading: Laparoscopic Testing
featuredServices.text: Minimally invasive surgical instruments for robotic platforms require precise characterization of grasping forces, articulation accuracy, and tissue manipulation capabilities. We evaluate instrument jaw closure forces, articulation precision through multi-degree motion, and durability under repeated actuations exceeding 10,000 cycles per procedure. Our testing protocols assess trocar seal integrity, instrument clearance through access ports, and mechanical stability during tissue manipulation. Our surgical suites feature complete laparoscopic towers and insufflation systems that replicate operating room conditions throughout validation studies.

featuredServices.heading: Robotic System Integration Testing
featuredServices.text: Complete robotic surgical systems require validation of teleoperation accuracy, force feedback calibration, and tremor filtration effectiveness. We test motion scaling verification, emergency stop response times, and software integration between console and patient cart. Our protocols evaluate haptic feedback latency, collision detection systems, and master console ergonomics during extended procedures. Our facility accommodates full robotic systems including patient carts, vision systems, and surgeon consoles configured to match clinical setups.

title: Medical Device Testing Laboratory | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
heroDescription: Complete preclinical testing services across biocompatibility, regulatory compliance, and GLP studies for medical device FDA submissions.
subpagesSectionDescription: Select your specific testing need below, or scroll down to learn more about our comprehensive medical device testing approach and specialized laboratory capabilities.

subpages.heading: Biocompatibility Testing
subpages.text: Complete ISO 10993 biological evaluation including cytotoxicity, sensitization, irritation, and systemic toxicity testing for FDA submissions.

subpages.heading: FDA Regulatory Testing
subpages.text: Complete 510(k) and PMA pathway support with device-specific regulatory guidance for successful FDA submissions.

subpages.heading: GLP Testing
subpages.text: 21 CFR Part 58 compliant preclinical studies with independent quality assurance oversight and inspection-ready documentation.

whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony Labs Medical Device Testing
whyChooseDescription: Four decades of medical device testing experience provides specialized infrastructure, regulatory expertise, and proven methodologies for successful FDA submissions.

whyChooseCards.heading: FDA Regulatory Excellence
whyChooseCards.text: Direct support for 510(k) and PMA pathways with device-specific regulatory guidance developed through dozens of successful submissions. Our regulatory team understands evolving FDA expectations and provides strategic counsel that optimizes approval timelines.

whyChooseCards.heading: Comprehensive Testing Portfolio
whyChooseCards.text: Custom protocols accommodate devices across cardiovascular, vascular intervention, gastroenterology, neurology, orthopedics, and general healthcare areas. Whether developing breakthrough innovations or improving existing technologies, our testing portfolio adapts to your specific requirements.

whyChooseCards.heading: Quality Assurance Leadership
whyChooseCards.text: AAALAC accreditation and GLP certification demonstrate our commitment to the highest quality standards. Complete traceability and comprehensive documentation support regulatory submissions across all pathways.

featuredServices.heading: Biocompatibility Testing
featuredServices.text: Device materials that interact with human tissue require comprehensive biological evaluation beyond basic cytotoxicity screening. We provide complete ISO 10993 biocompatibility testing including cytotoxicity, hemocompatibility, sensitization, and systemic toxicity evaluation under GLP-compliant protocols. Our AAALAC-accredited laboratory applies cardiovascular-specific adaptations for blood-contacting devices and chronic implants, delivering validated biocompatibility data that supports both 510(k) and PMA pathways.

featuredServices.heading: FDA Regulatory Testing
featuredServices.text: FDA submissions require testing that anticipates reviewer questions and addresses guidance documents precisely. We deliver regulatory testing designed by professionals who understand exactly what reviewers examine in device submissions. Our protocols align with current FDA guidance and expectations developed through hundreds of successful submissions. From 510(k) performance testing to complex PMA preclinical packages, our GLP-compliant laboratory generates data that withstands FDA scrutiny and transforms regulatory requirements into approval milestones.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About FDA Regulatory Testing

featuredServices.heading: GLP Testing
featuredServices.text: Data integrity determines submission success more than any other factor. We operate a purpose-built GLP laboratory where 21 CFR Part 58 compliance forms the foundation of every protocol and data point. Our quality assurance unit maintains independent oversight, ensuring protocol adherence and complete traceability that FDA demands. With inspection-ready documentation systems and AAALAC accreditation, we deliver GLP testing that removes regulatory uncertainty from your submission through comprehensive audit trails and validated methodologies.

title: Drug-Coated Balloon Testing | Synchrony Labs
heroDescription: Comprehensive combination product testing for drug-coated balloons across coating characterization, drug elution profiling, and vascular tissue uptake validation.
whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony for Drug-Coated Balloon Testing
whyChooseDescription: Our DCB testing capabilities stem from decades of balloon catheter specialization combined with deep understanding of combination product regulatory requirements.

whyChooseCards.heading: Dual Catheterization Laboratories
whyChooseCards.text: Two fully-equipped cath labs with high-resolution fluoroscopy, digital subtraction angiography, IVUS integration, and hemodynamic monitoring systems enable parallel testing programs and complex procedural simulations that replicate clinical conditions.

whyChooseCards.heading: Cardiovascular Specialists
whyChooseCards.text: Our team includes interventional specialists who understand deployment mechanics, veterinary pathologists experienced with vascular healing, and regulatory experts who've guided dozens of cardiovascular devices through successful FDA submissions.

whyChooseCards.heading: Proven Regulatory Success
whyChooseCards.text: Over four decades of exclusive cardiovascular device testing has produced hundreds of successful FDA submissions. Our submission success rate exceeds industry averages through comprehensive preclinical packages that address reviewer expectations.

featuredServices.heading: Comprehensive DCB Validation
featuredServices.text:
Drug-coated balloons need to prove they can maintain coating integrity through tortuous anatomy, transfer therapeutic drug concentrations during brief inflation periods, and achieve sustained tissue uptake that prevents restenosis. We test coating uniformity using micro-CT and scanning electron microscopy, characterize drug elution kinetics under physiological flow conditions, and quantify vascular tissue penetration through advanced histological analysis. Our protocols evaluate coating adhesion during catheter transit, drug release during balloon inflation, and therapeutic agent retention in vessel walls throughout extended follow-up periods.

From paclitaxel-eluting systems for peripheral intervention to novel drug formulations for coronary applications, our testing addresses both device performance and pharmaceutical requirements that define combination product submissions. Our catheterization laboratories feature specialized equipment for real-time coating visualization, drug distribution mapping, and tissue uptake quantification throughout the complete deployment sequence. Whether pursuing 510(k) clearance through predicate comparison or PMA approval for breakthrough formulations, our GLP-compliant protocols generate the comprehensive data packages FDA requires for combination product approval.
